NanoASV reference fasta file format requirements :

Your reference fasta file must fit the following :

- Correct fasta format with ">" based header, followed by sequence.
- Singleleaved and interleaved fasta files are both handled
- The header must contain in correct order :
    * A unique identifier (ex: AP017610.220271.221808)
    * A whitespace between the unique ID and the taxonomic informations
    * At least one level of taxonomic information. Multi-level taxonomy must be separated with semicolons (;)
        NanoASV currently handles up to 26 taxonomic levels which should be enough for most application. If it's not, please open an issue on github.

When using personal reference file, you should use the --no-r-cleaning flag. R cleaning step has been mostly intended to work with SILVA and bacterial sequences.

Both the following are valid examples : 

    > AP017610.220271.221808 Bacteria;Proteobacteria;Gammaproteobacteria;Enterobacterales;Enterobacteriaceae;Escherichia-Shigella;Escherichia coli
    

    >AP017610.220271.221808 Bacteria;Proteobacteria;Gammaproteobacteria;Enterobacterales;Enterobacteriaceae;Escherichia-Shigella;Escherichia coli
